title: Dúnedain
summary: In J. R. R. Tolkien's legendarium, the Dúnedain (/ˈduːnɛdaɪn/; singular: Dúnadan, "Man of the West") were a race of Men descended from the Númenóreans who survived the sinking of their island kingdom and came to Eriador in Middle-earth, led by Elendil and his sons, Isildur and Anárion.  They are also called Men of Westernesse (translated from the Sindarin term). They settled in Arnor and Gondor.
